1.verse: From Paul, an ·apostle [messenger] of Christ Jesus. ·I am an apostle because that is what God wanted […by the will of God]. To ·God’s holy people [the saints] living in Ephesus [a prominent city in the Roman province of Asia, present-day western Turkey; Acts 19], ·believers in [or who are faithful to] Christ Jesus:

2.verse: Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: Spiritual Blessings in Christ - ·Praise be to [or Blessed is] the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ. In Christ, God has given us every spiritual blessing in the heavenly ·world [realms; places].

4.verse: ·That is [or Just as; or For; Because], in Christ, he chose us before the ·world was made [foundation of the world] so that we would be his holy people—people ·without blame [or unblemished; as are sacrificial animals] before him.

5.verse: Because of his love [this phrase may go with the previous sentence], God ·had already decided to make us his own children [predestined us for adoption] through Jesus Christ. That was what he wanted and what pleased him,

6.verse: and it brings praise to God because of his ·wonderful [glorious] grace. God gave that grace to us freely, in ·Christ, the One he loves [the Beloved].

7.verse: In ·Christ [him] we ·are set free [have been redeemed/purchased] by ·the blood of his death [his blood; blood signifies his sacrificial death], and so we have forgiveness of sins. ·How rich is [or This redemption reveals the wealth of; …according to the riches of] God’s grace,

8.verse: which he has ·given to us so fully and freely [lavished on us]. With ·full [all] wisdom and understanding [this phrase may go with the previous sentence],

9.verse: God let us know ·his secret purpose [or the mystery of his will; a “mystery” in Scripture is something God had not previously disclosed]. This was what ·God wanted [pleased him], and he ·planned to do it [or set it forth; publicly revealed it] through Christ.

10.verse: His goal was to carry out his plan, ·when the right time came [or at the time of fulfillment; in the fullness of the times], that all things in heaven and on earth would be ·joined together [unified; or summed up; or renewed] in Christ as the head.

11.verse: In Christ we ·were chosen to be God’s people [have received/were given our part of an inheritance], ·because from the very beginning God had decided this [having been predestined] in keeping with his plan. And he is the One who ·makes everything agree [or accomplishes everything in accord] with what he decides and wants.

12.verse: We are the first people who hoped in ·Christ [the Messiah], and we were chosen so that we would bring praise to God’s glory.

13.verse: So it is with you. When you heard the ·true teaching [message/word of truth]—the ·Good News about [Gospel of] your salvation—you believed in Christ. ·And in Christ, God put his special mark of ownership on you by giving you […having been sealed with] the Holy Spirit that he had promised.

14.verse: That Holy Spirit is the ·guarantee [down payment; deposit] ·that we will receive what God promised for his people [of our inheritance] until ·God gives full freedom to those who are his [or we acquire possession of it; the redemption of the possession; v. 7]—to bring praise to God’s glory.

15.verse: Paul’s Prayer - That is why ·since [or because] I heard about your faith in the Lord Jesus and your love for all ·God’s people [the saints],

16.verse: I ·have not stopped [never cease] giving thanks to God for you. I always remember you in my prayers,

17.verse: asking the God of our Lord Jesus Christ, the glorious Father, to give you ·a spirit of wisdom [or spiritual wisdom; or the Spirit of wisdom] and revelation so that you will know him better.

18.verse: I pray also that ·you will have greater understanding in your heart [the eyes of your heart may be enlightened] so you will ·know [comprehend] the hope to which he has called us and that you will know ·how rich and glorious are the blessings God has promised [the riches of his glorious inheritance for; or the glorious wealth of an inheritance that God possesses in] ·his holy people [the saints].

19.verse: And you will know that God’s power is ·very [exceedingly; overwhelmingly] great for us who believe. That power ·is the same as [or was demonstrated in] the great strength

20.verse: God ·used [exerted] to raise Christ from the dead and ·put [seat] him at his right ·side [hand; Ps. 110:1; Acts 2:34] in the heavenly ·world [realm; places].

21.verse: God has put Christ ·over [far above] all rulers, authorities, powers, and ·kings [lords; dominion], and every other ·title given [name that is named] not only in this ·world [age] but also in the ·next [coming one].

22.verse: God ·put [subjected] everything under his ·power [feet; Ps. 8:6] and ·made him the head over everything for the church [or gave him to the church as head over all things], which is his body.

23.verse: ·The church is filled with Christ [or The church completes Christ; …the fullness of the one], who fills ·everything in every way [or all things everywhere; all in all].

1.verse: We Now Have Life - In the past you were ·spiritually dead [dead] ·because of [or in] your sins and ·the things you did against God [transgressions].

2.verse: Yes, in the past you ·lived [walked] ·the way the world lives [according to the course/ways/age of this world], following the ruler [Satan] of the ·evil powers that are above the earth [dominion/authority of the air; probably demonic forces]. That same spirit is now working in ·those who refuse to obey God [the children/sons of disobedience].

3.verse: In the past all of us lived ·like [or among] them, ·trying to please [or giving in to the cravings of] our ·sinful selves [sinful nature; flesh] and doing all the things our ·bodies [flesh] and minds wanted. We ·should have suffered God’s anger because we were sinful by nature [were by nature children/sons of wrath]. ·We were the same as all other people […just like the rest; of mankind].

4.verse: But ·God’s mercy is great [God is rich in mercy], and he loved us very much.

5.verse: Though we were spiritually dead because of ·the things we did against God [our transgressions], he ·gave us new life [brought us to life] with Christ. You have been saved by God’s grace.

6.verse: And he raised us up with Christ and gave us a seat with him in the ·heavens [heavenly places/realms]. He did this for those in Christ Jesus

7.verse: so that ·for all future time [in the ages to come] he could show the ·very great [exceeding; overwhelming] riches of his grace by being kind to us in Christ Jesus.

8.verse: ·I mean that [or For; Because] you have been saved by grace through ·believing [faith]. You did not save yourselves; it was a gift from God.

9.verse: It was not the result of ·your own efforts [works], so ·you cannot [no one can] ·brag about it [boast].

10.verse: ·God has made us what we are [For we are his handiwork/workmanship/work of art]. In Christ Jesus, God ·made [created] us to do good works, which God planned in advance for us to live our lives doing.

11.verse: One in Christ - [Therefore] Remember that you ·were born as Gentiles [are Gentiles in the flesh], the ones called “uncircumcised” by those who call themselves “circumcised.” (·Their circumcision is only something they themselves do on their bodies […performed in the flesh by hands].)

12.verse: Remember that ·in the past [at that time/season] you were without ·Christ [the Messiah]. You were ·not citizens [excluded from the citizenship] of Israel, and you ·had no part in [were aliens/strangers to] the ·agreements with the promise that God made to his people [covenants of promise; the Abrahamic (Gen. 12:1–3), Mosaic (Ex. 19—24), and Davidic (2 Sam. 7) covenants.] You had no hope, and you did not know God.

13.verse: But now in Christ Jesus, you who were far away from God are brought near through the blood of ·Christ’s death [Christ; blood symbolizing his sacrificial death].

14.verse: Christ himself is our peace. He made ·both Jews and Gentiles one people [both one], and broke down the wall of ·hate [hostility; enmity] that divided them [the wall beyond which Gentiles could not pass in the Jerusalem temple, or the law of Moses that distinguished Jew from Gentile (see v. 15)] ·by giving his own body [in his flesh; this phrase may go with the following sentence].

15.verse: He did this by ·ending [setting aside; nullifying] the law of commands and rules ·by giving his own body [in his flesh; this phrase may go with the previous sentence]. His purpose was to make the two groups of people become one new ·people [humanity; person; man] in him and in this way make peace.

16.verse: It was also Christ’s purpose to ·end [put to death; kill] the ·hatred [hostility; enmity] between the two groups, to make them into one body, and to ·bring them back [reconcile them] to God. ·Christ did all this with his death on the cross […through the cross].

17.verse: Christ came and ·preached [proclaimed the Good News of] peace [Is. 52:7] to you who were ·far away from God [far away/off], and to those who were ·near to God [near; Is. 57:19].

18.verse: ·Yes, it is [For; or So that] through Christ we all have ·the right to come [free access] to the Father ·in [by] one Spirit.

19.verse: Now you Gentiles are not foreigners or strangers any longer, but are citizens together with ·God’s holy people [the saints]. You belong to God’s ·family [household].

20.verse: ·You are like a building that was built […having been built] on the foundation of the apostles and prophets. Christ Jesus himself is the ·most important stone [cornerstone; or capstone; Is. 28:16; 1 Cor. 3:11] in that building,

21.verse: and that whole building is joined together in Christ. He makes it grow and become a holy temple in the Lord.

22.verse: And in Christ you, too, are being ·built together with the Jews [built together] into a place where God lives through the Spirit.

1.verse: Paul’s Work in Telling the Good News - ·So [For this reason] I, Paul, a prisoner [Paul is probably writing from house arrest in Rome, about AD 60; see Acts 28:30–31] of Christ Jesus ·for [for the sake of] you Gentiles—[Paul is about to pray for the Ephesians, but instead digresses into a description of his ministry until v. 14].

2.verse: Surely you have heard that God gave me this ·work [task; stewardship; commission] ·to tell you about his grace [of God’s grace for you].

3.verse: He let me know his ·secret [mystery; 1:9] by ·showing it to me [revelation]. I have already written ·a little [briefly] about this [either earlier in this letter or previously].

4.verse: ·If you read what I wrote then [or By reading this], you can see that I truly understand the ·secret [mystery] ·about [or revealed by; or that consists of; of] ·Christ [or the Messiah].

5.verse: ·People [The sons of men; a Hebrew way of referring to people] who lived in other ·times [generations] were not told that secret. But now, through the Spirit, God has ·shown [revealed] that secret to his holy apostles and prophets.

6.verse: This is that ·secret [mystery]: that through the ·Good News [Gospel] the Gentiles ·will share with the Jews in God’s blessing [are co-heirs]. They belong to the same body, and they share together in the promise that God made in Christ Jesus.

7.verse: By God’s special gift of grace given to me through ·his power [the working out/exercise of his power], I became a servant ·to tell that Good News [of this Gospel].

8.verse: I am the least important of all ·God’s people [the saints], but God gave me this ·gift [or grace]—to tell the Gentiles the ·Good News [Gospel] about the riches of Christ, which are ·too great to understand fully [unfathomable; or boundless].

9.verse: And God gave me the work of ·telling [making plain; enlightening] all people about the ·plan for [administration of; the same word translated “work” in v. 2] his ·secret [mystery], which has been hidden ·in [or by] him ·since the beginning of time [from the ages]. He is the One who created everything.

10.verse: His purpose was that through the church all the rulers and powers in the heavenly ·world [realm; places; 1:3, 20; 2:6] will now know God’s ·wisdom, which has so many forms [multi-faceted/multi-dimensional wisdom].

11.verse: ·This agrees with […according to] ·the plan God had since the beginning of time [his eternal purpose/plan], which he accomplished ·through [or in] Christ Jesus our Lord.

12.verse: In Christ we ·can come before [have access to] God with ·freedom [boldness; freedom to speak] and ·without fear [with confidence]. We can do this ·through faith in Christ [or because of Christ’s faithfulness].

13.verse: So I ·ask you not to become [or pray that you would not be] discouraged because of the ·sufferings [trials] I am having for you. My ·sufferings [trials; affliction] are ·for your glory [to bring you honor/eternal glory].

14.verse: The Love of Christ - So [Paul begins again the prayer he started in v. 1] I ·bow in prayer [kneel] before the Father

15.verse: from whom ·every [or the whole] ·family [a play on words, since the words “father” and “family” are related] in heaven and on earth gets its true name.

16.verse: I ask the Father ·in his great glory [or from the treasures of his glory; or out of his glorious riches] to give you the power to be strong ·inwardly [in the inner person] through his Spirit.

17.verse: I pray that Christ will ·live [make his home] in your hearts by faith and that your life will be ·strong in love and be built on love [rooted and grounded in love].

18.verse: And I pray that you and all ·God’s holy people [the saints] will have the power to ·understand [comprehend; grasp] the greatness of Christ’s love—how wide and how long and how high and how deep that love is.

19.verse: Christ’s love is ·greater than anyone can ever know [beyond comprehension/knowledge], but I pray that you will be able to know that love. ·Then […so that] you can be filled with the fullness of God.

20.verse: ·Glory be to God, who can [Now to the One who is able to] do much, much more than anything we can ask or imagine through his power working in us.

21.verse: To him be glory in the church and in Christ Jesus for all ·time [generations], forever and ever. Amen.

1.verse: The Unity of the Body - [Therefore,] As a prisoner [3:1] ·for [because I belong to; or in] the Lord, I urge you to ·live [walk] in a manner worthy of the calling ·you have received [to which you were called].

2.verse: ·Always be [or Be completely] humble, gentle, and patient, ·accepting [putting up/bearing with] each other in love.

3.verse: Make every effort to preserve the unity ·of [provided by; available through] the Spirit ·in [through] the ·peace that joins us together [bond of peace].

4.verse: There is one body and one Spirit, and God called you to ·have one hope [one hope of your calling].

5.verse: There is one Lord, one faith, and one baptism.

6.verse: There is one God and Father of everything. ·He rules everything and is everywhere and is in everything […who is over all and through all and in all].

7.verse: Each one of us has been given the ·special gift of grace [grace; or gift], ·showing how generous Christ is [or in proportion to Christ’s gift; according to the measure of Christ’s gift].

8.verse: That is why it says in the Scriptures, “When he ·went up [ascended] to the heights, he ·led a parade of captives [or took captives into captivity], and he gave gifts to people [Ps. 68:18].”

9.verse: When it says, “He ·went up [ascended],” what does it mean? ·It means […except] that he first ·came down [descended] to the ·earth [or lower regions, namely the earth; or the depths of the earth; probably refers to (1) the Incarnation, though possibly (2) Christ’s descent to Hades after his death (1 Pet. 3:19–20), or (3) Christ’s descent through the Spirit at Pentecost (Acts 2)].

10.verse: So the one who ·came down [descended] is the same one who ·went up [ascended] above all the heavens. ·Christ did that […in order] to fill ·everything with his presence [all things].

11.verse: And ·Christ gave gifts to people—he made some to be apostles, some to be prophets, some to go and tell the Good News, and some to have the work of caring for and teaching God’s people [he himself gave apostles, prophets, evangelists, pastors/shepherds, and teachers].

12.verse: ·Christ gave those gifts to prepare […to equip] God’s holy people for the work of serving, to make the body of Christ stronger.

13.verse: This work must continue until we ·are all joined together in the same faith [or all reach unity in the faith] and in the same knowledge of the Son of God. We must become like ·a mature person [or the perfect Man; Christ], ·growing until we become like Christ and have his perfection [to the measure of the stature of Christ’s fullness].

14.verse: Then we will no longer be ·babies [children]. We will not be tossed about like a ship that the waves carry one way and then another. We will not be ·influenced by every new teaching [carried along by every wind of (false) teaching] we hear from people who are trying to ·fool [trick] us. They ·make plans [scheme] and try any kind of trick to fool people into following ·the wrong path [error; false teaching].

15.verse: ·No! [Instead; Rather] ·Speaking [or Living out; Practicing] the truth with love, we will grow up in every way into Christ, who is the head.

16.verse: ·The whole body depends on Christ, and […through/by whom] all the parts of the body are joined and held together. Each ·part [supporting joint/ligament] ·does its own work [performs its function] to make the whole body grow and ·be strong with [to build itself up in] love.

17.verse: The Way You Should Live - ·In the Lord’s name [or By the Lord’s authority; In the Lord], I ·tell you [speak and testify to] this. Do not continue ·living [walking] like ·those who do not believe [the pagans; the Gentiles], whose thoughts are ·worth nothing [futile].

18.verse: They ·do not understand [are darkened in their minds/understanding] and they are ·separated [excluded; alienated] from the life ·God gives [or God has; of God] because of their ignorance ·and because of [or caused by] ·their stubbornness [or their closed minds; the stubbornness of their heart/mind].

19.verse: They have lost ·all feeling of shame [or any sense of right and wrong; all feeling/sensitivity], and they ·use their lives for doing evil [abandon themselves to indecency/depravity]. They ·continually want to do [or greedily pursue] all kinds of ·evil [impurity].

20.verse: But ·what you learned in Christ was not like this [or that is not how you learned about Christ; you did not learn Christ that way].

21.verse: ·I know that […if indeed] you heard ·about him [or him], and you ·are in him, so you were taught the truth that is in Jesus [or were taught by him, because the truth is in Jesus].

22.verse: You were taught to ·leave [put off; lay aside] your old ·self [person]—to stop living the evil way you lived before. That old self ·becomes worse [is decaying/being corrupted], because ·people are fooled by the evil things they want to do [of the deceitfulness of their desires].

23.verse: But you were taught to be made new in ·your hearts [the spirit/attitude of your minds],

24.verse: to ·become [put on; clothe yourself with] the new ·self [person; or Man; become like Christ]. That new person is created ·to be like God [or in God’s image; according to God]—truly good and holy [or in the righteousness and holiness that comes from truth].

25.verse: So you must stop telling lies. ·Tell each other the truth [Let each one of you speak truthfully to his neighbor; Zech. 8:16], because we ·all belong to each other in the same body [are members of one another].

26.verse: ·When you are angry, [or Be angry, and] do not sin [Ps. 4:4; there is a time for righteous anger, but it must not result in sin], and ·be sure to stop being angry before the end of the day [don’t let the sun set on your anger].

27.verse: Do not give the devil a ·way to defeat you [foothold; opportunity].

28.verse: Those who are stealing must stop stealing and start working. They should ·earn an honest living for themselves [do something good/useful with their hands]. Then they will have something to share with those who ·are poor [have need].

29.verse: Don’t ·say anything that will hurt others [let any rotten/unhealthy word come from your mouth], but only say what is ·helpful [good] to ·make others stronger [build others up] ·and meet [according to] their needs. Then what you say will ·do good [give grace; be a gift] to those who listen to you.

30.verse: And do not ·make the Holy Spirit sad [grieve/bring sorrow to the Holy Spirit]. ·The Spirit is God’s proof that you belong to him and he will make you free when the final day comes […by whom you were sealed for the day of redemption].

31.verse: Do not be bitter or angry or ·mad [raging]. Never shout angrily or ·say things to hurt [slander; insult] others. ·Never do anything [Get rid of all kinds of] evil.

32.verse: Be kind and ·loving [compassionate; tenderhearted] to each other, and forgive each other just as God forgave you in Christ.

1.verse: Living in the Light - You are God’s children whom he loves, so ·try to be like [imitate] him.

2.verse: ·Live a life of love [Walk in love] just as Christ loved us and gave himself for us as a ·sweet-smelling [fragrant] offering and sacrifice to God.

3.verse: But there must be ·no [no hint/mention/rumor of] sexual sin among you, or any kind of ·evil [impurity] or greed. Those things are not ·right [proper; fitting] for God’s holy people.

4.verse: Also, there must be no ·evil talk [obscenity; filthiness] among you, and you must not speak foolishly or tell ·evil [crude; coarse; vulgar] jokes. These things are ·not right for you [out of place/character]. Instead, you should be giving thanks to God.

5.verse: [For] You can be sure of this: No one will have a ·place [inheritance] in the kingdom of Christ and of God who sins sexually, or does ·evil [impure] things, or is greedy. Anyone who is greedy is ·serving a false god [an idolater].

6.verse: Do not let anyone ·fool [deceive] you ·by telling you things that are not true [or with shallow philosophies; with empty words], because these things will bring God’s ·anger [wrath] on ·those who do not obey him [the children/sons of disobedience].

7.verse: So ·have nothing to do with them [or do not partner/associate with them].

8.verse: In the past you were ·full of darkness [darkness], but now you are ·full of light [light] in the Lord. So ·live [walk] like children ·who belong to [living in; of] the light.

9.verse: ·Light brings [For the fruit of the light is] every kind of goodness, ·right living [righteousness], and truth.

10.verse: ·Try to learn [Discern; Test and prove] what pleases the Lord.

11.verse: ·Have nothing to do with [Take no part in] the things done in darkness, which are ·not worth anything [unfruitful]. But ·show that they are wrong [expose them].

12.verse: [For] It is shameful even to talk about what those people do in secret.

13.verse: But the light makes all things ·easy to see [visible; exposed],

14.verse: and everything that is ·made easy to see [visible; exposed] ·can become [or becomes a; is] light. This is why it is said: “Wake up, sleeper! Rise from death, and Christ will ·shine on [give light to] you [likely an early Christian hymn based on Is. 26:19 and 60:1–2].”

15.verse: So be very careful how you ·live [walk]. Do not ·live [walk] like those who are ·not wise [foolish], but ·live wisely [like those who are wise].

16.verse: ·Take advantage of every opportunity [or Make the most of your time; …redeeming the time/season], because ·these are evil times [the days are evil].

17.verse: So do not be ·foolish [ignorant] but ·learn what the Lord wants you to do [or understand the Lord’s will].

18.verse: Do not be drunk with wine, which ·will ruin you [is debauchery/reckless living], but be filled with the Spirit.

19.verse: ·Speak […speaking] to each other with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making music in your hearts to the Lord.

20.verse: ·Always give […always giving] thanks to God the Father for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.

21.verse: Wives and Husbands - ·Yield [Submit; Be subject; …yielding/submitting; grammatically linked to the previous sentence, and so part of being filled with the Spirit] to each other out of ·reverence [respect; fear; awe] for Christ.

22.verse: Wives, ·yield to [submit to; be subject to; to] your husbands, as you do to the Lord,

23.verse: because the husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church. And he is the Savior of the body, which is the church.

24.verse: As the church ·yields [submits; is subject] to Christ, so you wives should ·yield [submit; be subject] to your husbands in everything [Col. 3:18; 1 Pet. 3:1–6].

25.verse: Husbands, love your wives as Christ loved the church [Col. 3:19; 1 Pet. 3:7] and gave himself for her

26.verse: to ·make her holy [sanctify her], cleansing her in the washing of water by the word [the “washing” may be (1) baptism, (2) spiritual cleansing (Titus 3:5), or (3) an analogy drawn from the Jewish prenuptial bath (Ezek. 16:8–14); the “word” may be (1) the Gospel, (2) a baptismal formula, or (3) the confession of the one baptized].

27.verse: He did this so that he could present the church to himself ·like a bride in all her beauty [in splendor; glorious], with no ·evil or sin [stain or wrinkle] or any other ·wrong thing in it [such thing], but ·pure [holy] and ·without fault [blameless].

28.verse: In the same way, husbands should love their wives as they love their own bodies. The man who loves his wife loves himself.

29.verse: [For] No one ever hates his own ·body [flesh], but feeds and takes care of it. And that is what Christ does for the church,

30.verse: because we are ·parts [members] of his body.

31.verse: The Scripture says, “·So [For this reason] a man will leave his father and mother and be ·united [joined] with his wife, and the two will become one ·body [flesh; Gen. 2:24].”

32.verse: This ·secret [mystery] is ·very important [or great; profound]—I am talking about Christ and the church.

33.verse: ·But [However; In any case; or To sum up] each one of you must love his wife as he loves himself, and a wife must ·respect [reverence; v. 21] her husband.

1.verse: Children and Parents - Children, obey your parents ·as the Lord wants [in the Lord], because this is ·the right thing to do [right; just].

2.verse: The command says, “Honor your father and mother [Ex. 20:12; Deut. 5:16].” This is the first command that has a promise with it—

3.verse: “Then everything will be well with you, and you will have a long life on the earth [Ex. 20:12; Deut. 5:16].”

4.verse: ·Fathers [or Parents; Heb. 11:23], do not make your children angry, but raise them with the ·training [discipline] and ·teaching [instruction] of the Lord [Col. 3:21].

5.verse: Slaves and Masters - ·Slaves [Bondservants], obey your ·masters here on earth [human masters; masters according to the flesh; Col. 3:22; 1 Pet. 2:18–25] with ·respect [fear] and ·fear [trembling] and from a sincere heart, ·just as you [or as you would] obey Christ.

6.verse: You must do this not only ·while they are watching you [with eye-service], ·to please them [as people-pleasers]. But as ·slaves [bondservants] of Christ, do ·what God wants [God’s will] ·with all your [or from the] heart.

7.verse: Do your work ·with enthusiasm [willingly; cheerfully]. Work as if you were serving the Lord, not people.

8.verse: ·Remember […knowing] that the Lord will give ·a reward [or back] to everyone, slave or free, for doing good.

9.verse: Masters, treat your slaves the same way. Do not threaten them. Remember that the One who is your Master and their Master is in heaven, and he ·treats everyone alike [has no favorites; shows no favoritism].

10.verse: Wear the Full Armor of God - Finally, be strong in the Lord and in his ·great [strong; mighty] power.

11.verse: Put on the full armor of God so that you can fight against the devil’s ·evil tricks [schemes].

12.verse: [For] Our ·fight [conflict; struggle] is not against ·people on earth [flesh and blood] but against the rulers and authorities and the ·powers [or cosmic powers/rulers] of this ·world’s darkness [darkness], against the spiritual powers of evil in the heavenly ·world [realm; places].

13.verse: ·That is why you need to [For this reason,] put on God’s full armor. Then on the day of evil [persecution generally or end-time tribulation] you will be able to ·stand strong [keep your ground; resist the enemy]. And ·when you have finished the whole fight [after you have done/accomplished everything], you will still be standing.

14.verse: So stand ·strong [or ready], with the belt of truth tied around your waist and the ·body armor [breastplate] of ·right living [a righteous life; or God’s own righteousness/justice; righteousness].

15.verse: On your feet wear the ·Good News [Gospel] of peace ·to help you stand strong [for firm footing; or to be fully prepared].

16.verse: And ·also [in addition to all this; or in all circumstances] use the shield of faith with which you can ·stop [extinguish] all the ·burning arrows [fiery darts] of the Evil One.

17.verse: ·Accept [Receive; or Take] the helmet of salvation, and take the sword of the Spirit, which is the ·word [message] of God.

18.verse: Pray ·in [or in dependence on] the Spirit at all times with all ·kinds of prayers [prayers and requests], asking for everything you need. To do this you must always be ·ready [alert] ·and never give up [with all perseverance]. Always pray for all ·God’s people [the saints].

19.verse: Also pray for me that when I ·speak [open my mouth], God will give me words so that I can tell the ·secret [mystery] of the ·Good News [Gospel] ·without fear [confidently; boldly].

20.verse: ·For this Good News […for which] I am an ambassador in ·prison [chains; 3:1]. Pray that I will speak ·it [or for him; or in him] ·without fear [boldly; confidently], as I should.

21.verse: Final Greetings - Tychicus [Acts 20:4; Col. 4:7; 2 Tim. 4:12; Titus 3:12], our ·brother whom we love [dear/beloved brother] and a faithful servant ·of the Lord’s work [or in the Lord] will tell you everything that is happening with me. Then you will know how I am and what I am doing.

22.verse: I am sending him to you for this reason—so that you will know how we are, and he can encourage ·you [your hearts].

23.verse: Peace and love with faith to you brothers and sisters from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

24.verse: Grace to all of you who love our Lord Jesus Christ with ·love that never ends [an imperishable/undying love].
